content: You've travelled so far and yet there seems to be no end to this abyss...
As you take a break to check your gear, you hear that familiar song from your dreams clearer than ever before...
An ethereal green glow illuminates the darkness, the sound of the haunting tune becoming louder as it approaches...
The massive hull of a ghost ship slows to a stop next to you, there seems to be no crew on deck, the song stops playing...
As you swim up you see the intimidating figure securing a large iron padlock on the scuttle hatch of the deck...

content.option: "E-excuse me... did you hear that music?"

content: [sound:arr|emotion:neutral|action:enter] A glowing figure peers over the starboard side, locking gazes with you. He is a terrifying figure, yet there's a comforting familiarity to him...

content.option: [bad] "Can I board to sit and rest a while?"

content: [sound:avast|emotion:angry|action:enter] The glowing figure whirls around to face you, clearly surprised by your appearance. You flounder in your diving suit in shock as this figure had a beard of tentacles and inky black eyes...
[sound:annoyed|emotion:angry] A low growl comes from him, the tentacles that make up his beard curl slightly in frustration. Yet, from where you stood you could see a sadness in his dark eyes..
[emotion:happy] You could have sworn his ghostly features seemed pleased with you, making your heart skip a beat...
[sound:arr|emotion:angry] "Arrg! An just who might ye be?" He moved away from the hatch closing the distance between you with surprising speed, his cutlass drawn and pointed at you...

content.option: [bad] Try to see what he was locking away under the hatch
[good] Raise your hands and apologize for intruding

content: [emotion:angry] "Be on yer way, Abysswalker... Ye 'ave no business 'ere on me ship..." He turns his shoulder to you...

content.option: "Can I at least get your name?"

content: [emotion:happy] "Ye can 'ear the song of the sea, ye must be truly special, Abysswalker." He chuckles and the sound of it was melodic on its own.
[emotion:angry] You move in the water to peer around him, distant cries of hundreds of voices can be heard from below the hatch...
[emotion:neutral] "Captain Octavian Tidebreaker..." With that he made his way to the helm and with the creak of the hull the great ship turned, the current filling it's ghostly sails...
[sound:annoyed|emotion:neutral] He stares you down, not quite sure if he can trust you yet...
[emotion:neutral] "Aye... Why don't ye meet with me again and I can tell ye more about it..." He looks over his shoulder at something...
[emotion:angry] Suddenly your vision blurs and the next thing you know, you're back adrift above the abyss, that distant glow of the ghostly sails descending...

content.option: "He's hiding something. I'm going to find out what..."

content: [emotion:sad] "Ye be treading dangerous waters, Abysswalker... Best ye keep on yer way and make the journey home." He escorts you off the ship, you can't help feeling like you've disappointed him...

content.option: I can't go home, not until I find the song from my dreams...

content: [emotion:neutral] You watch as the glow of his ship becomes shrouded in the darkness below
[emotion:neutral] Suddenly a loud rumbling could be heard from the fathoms below and he swam away from the edge of the ship, the tattered sails unfurling seemingly on their own...
[emotion:angry] You follow his ship into the darkness, the glow of his ship acting as your guiding light...
[emotion:sad] "Then ye be best prepared to face the infernal wretchedness of the fathoms below..." He squeezes your shoulder through the diving suit.
[emotion:happy] "If ye stay alive I'll be sure to find ye, love!" His smokey chuckle carried on the current, he gave the helm a spin, the creak of the hull is deafening as it turns...
[emotion:neutral] "It only grows more perilous from 'ere, ye been warned, Abysswalker..." He turns from you and you watch as he sails his ship further below.
"Octavian!" He lets out a bellowing laugh as the glow of his ship recedes into the depths. That haunting music beginning to play once again.
